name: Dried Chicken Arrozcaldo
description: Indulge in a comforting bowl of Dried Chicken Arrozcaldo, a healthy twist on the traditional Filipino porridge. Packed with high-protein chicken, enriched with the healing qualities of ginger, and made with Adlai rice for a low-sugar option, this recipe is perfect for those seeking a nutritious yet heartwarming meal. Perfect for anyone on a low-sodium diet, this healthified recipe brings warmth and wellness to your table.

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the 300 gram of chicken thigh into cubes, peel and mince the 5.00 g of ginger root, and dice the 70.00 g of capsicum.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse 190 g of Adlai Rice (Job's Tears) under cold water until the water runs clear.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, bring 4 cups (8 fl oz) of water to a boil. Add the minced ginger, 2 tsp of ground ginger, and 0.25 tsp of black pepper. Let it simmer for 5 minutes to infuse the water with ginger flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cubed chicken thighs to the pot and simmer until they are fully cooked, approximately 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rinsed Adlai Rice to the pot and let it simmer until the rice is tender and the porridge has thickened, about 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Halfway through the cooking, add the diced capsicum and 1 pcs of organic coco sugar into the pot. Stir well.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Season the arrozcaldo with additional black pepper according to taste. Serve hot and enjoy your healthy and comforting meal.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
